info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 2:48PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Yavapai County through 345 PM MST... At 247 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Castle Hot Springs, or 15 miles southwest of Black Canyon City, moving northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Congress, Wilhoit, Walnut Grove, Groom Creek Subdivision, Kirkland, Black Canyon City, Castle Hot Springs, Walker, Wagoner, Yarnell, Ponderosa Park, Crown King, Rock Springs, Peeples Valley, Lower Wolf Creek Campground, Hazlett Hollow Campground, Turney Gulch Group Campground, Glen Ilah and Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 242 and 249. State Route 89 between mile markers 265 and 307. State Route 71 between mile markers 108 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
